Eagles wide receiver DeSean Jackson told NFL Network on Sunday that Michael Vick is "a big brother" to him and he's looking forward to a full offseason working with the quarterback. linebacker Desmond Bishop stepped into the picture and with a mighty one-handed swipe took DeSean Jackson down with a shoestring tackle at the Packers' 38-yard line. "That was big," Packers defensive end Ryan Pickett said. Actually it saved the game. That's a touchdown-saving tackle. Thanks to Desmond Bishop , DeSean Jackson was stopped in his tracks after a 28-yard reception. Four plays later Eagles quarterback Michael Vick threw his fateful interception to Tramon Williams in the end zone to seal the Packers' 21-16 victory

She noted that local jurisdictions already have control over police services and operate their departments differently, even though they are all upholding the same law. You only realign programs that you are comfortable with some variation in level of services... and where you think there's enough local accountability to make sure the program is run right, she said. "If you are not,... it's probably a program best administered and controlled at the state level." Treasurer Bill Lockyer says Newt Gingrich proposal to let states file for...
